remarks: A constructed tuple is a point in a structure product iff each coordinate is in the proper base set.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 10-Jan-2015.)
statement:
prdsbasmpt.y $e |- Y = ( S Xs_ R ) $.
prdsbasmpt.b $e |- B = ( Base ` Y ) $.
prdsbasmpt.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. V ) $.
prdsbasmpt.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. W ) $.
prdsbasmpt.r $e |- ( ph -> R Fn I ) $.
prdsbasmpt $p |- ( ph -> ( ( x e. I |-> U ) e. B <-> A. x e. I U e. ( Base ` ( R ` x ) ) ) ) $.
$d B x $.
$d I x $.
$d R x $.
$d S x $.
$d V x $.
$d W x $.
$d Y x $.
$d ph x $.
